court: IN IN IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY
judgment_text:
:1:

IN IN IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY

IN IN IN INSOLVENCY INSOLVENCY INSOLVENCY

REPORT REPORT REPORT NO. 156 OF 2006 NO. 156 OF 2006 NO. 156 OF 2006

IN IN IN

INSOLVENCY INSOLVENCY INSOLVENCY NO. 14 OF 1970 NO. 14 OF 1970 NO. 14 OF 1970

Re.: Dharshi Korsi.

... Insolvent.

Ex-parte :

M/s. Purushottam Liladhar.

... Petitioning Creditors.

.....

Mr. G.G. Ketkar, 1st Asstt. to Official Assignee.

.....

CORAM CORAM CORAM : DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD,J. : DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD,J. : DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD,J.

ND ND ND DECEMBER, 2006. DECEMBER, 2006. DECEMBER, 2006.

P.C. P.C. P.C. : : :

.

The Official Assignee has prayed that the balance

of

Rs.8,085.94

be transferred to the Unclaimed

Dividend

Capital

Account

under Rule of the Bombay

Insolvency

Rules, and

thereafter to

the

Unclaimed

Dividend

Capital

Revenue Account and the account may be closed for

the administrative purposes. The relevant details are as

follows :-

(i)

The order of adjudication was passed on 19th

February 1970.

(ii)

The aggregate balance lying with the account of the

estate is Rs.8,085.94. No further recoveries are possible

in the estate.

.

The report is made absolute in terms of prayer

clause (a).
